snippet: More arrests are expected in the investigation into one of the most audacious art frauds in recent memory, a federal prosecutor told a judge on Monday.
abstract: Glafira Rosales, obscure art dealer charged in one of the most audacious art frauds in recent memory, is arraigned in federal court in Manhattan; Rosales was arrested on money laundering and tax charges in scheme that spanned 15 years and included sale of more than $80 million of dozens of works said to have been by Modernist masters; prosecutors tell judge that more arrests are expected in the ongoing investigation.
lead_paragraph: More arrests are expected in the investigation into one of the most audacious art frauds in recent memory, a federal prosecutor told a judge on Monday.

headline.main: Prosecutors Are Contemplating More Arrests in $80 Million Art Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Are Contemplating More Arrests in $80 Million Art Fraud Case
